document.docTitle: Reinhardorhynchus pacificus Diez, Reygel & Artois 2021, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomy and phylogeny of Koinocystididae (Platyhelminthes, Kalyptorhynchia) with the description of three new genera and twelve new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material and distribution.
Observations on live specimens, whole mounted afterwards. Two whole mounts collected in Playa Venao ( 08¬∞53‚Äô06‚ÄùN ; 79¬∞36‚Äô07‚ÄùW ) (Type Locality), Vera Cruz , Panama (
December 2, 2011
), one of which is designated holotype ( USNM 1642506 ), the other one in the USNM (1642507), coarse-grained sand with fine silt, salinity 30
‚Ä∞.
Etymology. The two specimens were found at the Pacific coast of Panama .

Diagnosis. Species of
Reinhardorhynchus
gen. n.
with a copulatory bulb encompassing a papillary cirrus, an ejaculatory cirrus, an accessory cirrus, and two hooks. Ejaculatory cirrus ¬±171 Œºm long, armed with scale-like spines along its entire length that are ¬±5 Œºm wide proximally and ¬±2 Œºm wide distally. Few larger triangular spines occur proximally (¬±10 Œºm long) and distally (¬±4 Œºm long). Accessory cirrus ¬±92 Œºm long, proximally armed with ¬±6-Œºm-long triangular spines and distally with 3-Œºm-long triangular spines and ¬±3-Œºm-wide and scale-like spines. Distal rims of these spines serrated, bearing ¬±1-Œºm-long spinules. Papillary cirrus ¬±62 Œºm long, proximally cov- ered by fine spines of ¬±2 Œºm long and distally with ¬±6-Œºm-long triangular spines. The hooks are ¬±83 Œºm long and ¬±81 Œºm long, respectively.

Description. The specimens are 1.7 mm long, colourless, with two eyes ( Fig. 13A : e). The brain ( Fig. 13A : br) is located caudally from the proboscis. The proboscis ( Fig. 13A : pr) has the typical koinocystidid morphology (see Brunet 1972 ; Karling 1980 ) and shows a strong junction sphincter; it represents 10% of the body length in live specimens. The pharynx ( Fig. 13A : ph) has a diameter of ¬±15% of the body length in live specimens, and is located at 30‚Äì40%. Caudally in the body some eosinophilic glands occur ( Fig. 13A : cgl).

The two testes ( Fig. 13A : t) are located rostrally from the pharynx. The seminal vesicles ( Fig. 12D & 13A : sv) fuse proximally from the copulatory bulb, forming a short seminal duct. The copulatory bulb is 363‚Äì403 Œºm long ( xÃÑ = 383 Œºm; n = 2). It encompasses the prostate vesicle ( Fig. 13A : pv), the ejaculatory cirrus (terminology of Karling 1978 ), an accessory cirrus, a papillary cirrus (terminology of Karling 1978 ), and two distal hooks. The ejaculatory cirrus ( Fig. 12D‚ÄìE & 13A : ci, 13B) is 162‚Äì180 Œºm long ( xÃÑ = 171 Œºm; n = 2) and armed with scalelike spines over its entire length. These spines are 5‚Äì6 Œºm wide ( xÃÑ = 5 Œºm; n = 20) proximally and 2‚Äì3 Œºm wide ( xÃÑ = 2 Œºm; n = 20) distally. Additionally, a number of larger triangular spines occur proximally, measuring 6‚Äì13 Œºm ( xÃÑ = 10 Œºm; n = 10), and a group of small triangular spines is present distally, measuring 3‚Äì4 Œºm ( xÃÑ = 4 Œºm; n = 13). The accessory cirrus ( Fig. 12D‚ÄìE & 13A : ac, 13C) is 89‚Äì95 Œºm long ( xÃÑ = 92 Œºm; n = 2), proximally armed with triangular spines 4‚Äì10 Œºm long ( xÃÑ = 6 Œºm; n = 24) and distally with triangular spines 2‚Äì4 Œºm long ( xÃÑ = 3 Œºm; n = 9) and scale-like spines 2‚Äì5 Œºm wide ( xÃÑ = 3 Œºm; n = 15). The distal rim of the scale-like spines of the accessory cirrus is serrated, with 1-Œºm-long spinules. The spiny part of the papillary cirrus ( Fig. 12D‚ÄìE , 13A & 13D : pc) is 55‚Äì69 Œºm long ( xÃÑ = 62 Œºm; n = 2) and proximally enclosed in a papilla ( Fig. 13D : pa). Papilla and cirrus are separated from each other by a sphincter ( Fig. 13D : sph). The papillary cirrus is proximally armed with fine spines, ¬±2 Œºm long, and distally with triangular spines, 4‚Äì8 Œºm long ( xÃÑ = 6 Œºm; n = 6). The two funnel-shaped distal hooks are nearly equal in size. One hook ( Fig. 12D‚ÄìE & 13A : h 1, 13E ) is 79‚Äì86 Œºm long ( xÃÑ = 83 Œºm; n = 2) and 40‚Äì43 Œºm wide at its base ( xÃÑ = 42 Œºm; n = 2). The other hook ( Fig. 12D‚ÄìE & 13A : h2, 13F) is 79‚Äì83 Œºm long ( xÃÑ = 81 Œºm; n = 2) and 59‚Äì65 Œºm wide at its base ( xÃÑ = 62 Œºm; n = 2).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 13.
Reinhardorhynchus pacificus
sp. n.
. A, general organisation (from a live animal). B, ejaculatory cirrus. C, accessory cirrus. D, papillary cirrus. E, larger hook. F, smaller hook. B‚ÄìF, from the holotype. All with proximal end toward top of figure.
